snippet: So far, under a million birds have been culled, a small part of the 240 million raised a year. But farmers must destroy entire flocks to keep the virus from spreading.
abstract: Virulent, deadly flu virus has infected American turkey flock, almost certainly coming from migrating wild waterfowl like Canada geese; turkey farmers in Minnesota have been forced to euthanize more than half a million turkeys, and poultry farms there and in other states hit by virus are under quarantine; flu outbreaks have caused many foreign countries to ban or cut back imports of American poultry products.
lead_paragraph: So far, under a million birds have been culled, a small part of the 240 million raised a year. But farmers must destroy entire flocks to keep the virus from spreading.

headline.main: Brought by Wild Neighbors, Deadly Bird Flu Attacks Turkey Flocks
headline.print_headline: Brought by Wild Neighbors, a Deadly Flu Attacks Turkey Flocks
